meanings.definition: A weight used to balance another weight.
meanings.sent1: The small weight acted as a counterbalance to the heavy object.
meanings.sent2: The counterbalance helped keep the scale steady.
meanings.sent3: The counterbalance and the heavy weight were like dance partners, moving in perfect harmony.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was the counterbalance to his seriousness, creating a perfect balance.
meanings.sent5: The counterbalance swung gently, creating a soothing rhythm in the room.

meanings.definition: To have an equal and opposite effect on something to neutralize or cancel it out.
meanings.sent1: His positive attitude helped counterbalance the negativity in the room.
meanings.sent2: Adding sugar will counterbalance the bitterness of the coffee.
meanings.sent3: Her love for spicy food seemed to counterbalance her dislike for sweet treats.
meanings.sent4: The bright colors of the painting counterbalanced the dark furniture in the room.
meanings.sent5: The music counterbalanced the silence, filling the room with energy.
